ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Release 1.10.0 pending
ygData.msgSnippet: Doc. can go in up to the second before release.  I d say end-of-this week, start-of-next should see release of 1.10.0 unless we trip over the unexpected. Good

Doc. can go in up to the second before release.  I'd say end-of-this 
week, start-of-next should see release of 1.10.0 unless we trip over the 
unexpected.

Good on you Frank,
St.Ack


Frank McCown wrote:
>
> I could give it a stab in the next few days. Is there a hard deadline
> for finishing up the documentation?
>
> Frank
>
> Michael Stack wrote:
> >
> >
> > Sounds great Frank. Any chance you'd like to take a first cut at it
> > even if it was only an outline for the rest of us to fill in.
> > Good stuff,
> > St.Ack
> >
> > Frank McCown wrote:
> > >
> > > Stack,
> > >
> > > It may be a little late to request this, but I thought it would be
> > > really useful to list several use cases in the user manual for the 
> most
> > > typical types of crawls that people like to do. For example:
> > >
> > > Case 1: Suppose you want to crawl only pages from a particular 
> host, and
> > > you want to avoid crawling too many pages of the dynamically generated
> > > calendar. Here's how you would use the DecidingScope to setup this
> > > crawl...
> > >
> > > Case 2: Suppose you wanted to only grab 5 pages from each of the 
> 10 the
> > > seeds...
> > >
> > > Case 3: Suppose you only want to crawl URLs that match
> > > http://foo.org/bar/* <http://foo.org/bar/*> <http://foo.org/bar/* 
> <http://foo.org/bar/*>> <http://foo.org/bar/* <http://foo.org/bar/*>
> > <http://foo.org/bar/* <http://foo.org/bar/*>>> and you only want to 
> crawl
> > > URLs that end with .html...
> > >
> > > Each of the use cases could point out how the fetchers, extractors,
> > > decide rules, canonicalizer, etc. would effect the crawl. This would
> > > have been really helpful to me when I was a newbie. :)
> > >
> > > Frank
> > >
>
>
